data.meta_description: In this week's Hip2Keto Book Club, we dove into part 1 of Head Strong and learned all about the mitochondria and what causes brain weaknesses!
data.text:
More energy, a sharper brain, a happier you.

My favorite kind of book is one that elevates my life. Fortunately, Head Strong is already doing that within the first 4 chapters! If you like a no-b.s. book that doesnâ€™t sugar-coat the truth (p.s. you wonâ€™t be eating anything sugar-coated on the Head Strong program), then youâ€™ll love this read.

When I heard that Dave Aspreyâ€™s Head Strong would be the star of our May book club, I was immediately eager and excited to start reading. Iâ€™ve listened to Dave on numerous podcasts and have learned so much cool stuff about the human brain and body and how they are affected by, well, pretty much everything around us.

This book isnâ€™t juicy like a thriller or mystery book though. Itâ€™s juicy in the kind of way that makes you go, â€œWow, I had no idea!â€ and, â€œholy cow, thatâ€™s why Iâ€™ve been feeling this way!â€

If you didnâ€™t get a chance to read chapters 1-4 of Head Strong yet, hereâ€™s what you need to know:

Spoilers ahead! ğŸš¨

Part 1 of Head Strong introduces us to â€œbrain kryptonite,â€ a.k.a. anything that steals necessary energy from our brain and delivers it to another part of the body. The crippling result shows up in numerous ways, which Dave Asprey refers to as The Five Brain Weaknesses.

If you can relate to any of the following scenarios, youâ€™re suffering from at least one of those weaknessesâ€¦

Losing your train of thought frequently

Major sugar cravings after a meal

Fatigue in loud and overwhelming environments

Poor sleep quality

Mood swings

Depression

The good news is that the Head Strong program promises to cure all of these awful things! As you continue reading, you learn about the â€œMighty Mitochondriaâ€ and the science behind whatâ€™s really going on with our body and our brain.

It might feel like a flashback to biology class for a few pages, but keep reading because it gets better and better!

Here are our key takeaways from Head Strong, Part 1 that youâ€™ll want to remember:

â€œCertain foods, products in our environment, types of light, and even forms of exercise can weaken your brain. This brain kryptonite doesnâ€™t kill youâ€”at least not at firstâ€”it just slowly and stealthily eat away at your battery life.â€

â€œThe first symptom that your mitochondria are overtaxed is fatigue. It causes cravings, moodiness, brain fog, forgetfulness, and lack of focus.â€

â€œThe energy drain we deal with on a daily basis is a classic case of death by a thousand cuts. We live in an increasingly toxic world, and most of us eat toxic food.â€

â€œThere is a way to change the amount of energy being delivered to your brain so that its energy level actually exceeds its demands. Once you learn how to do this, your brain can function like that brand-new phone fresh out of the packageâ€”fast, responsive, and highly charged.â€

â€œForgetfulness, cravings, low energy, moodiness, and inability to focus are all symptoms of low brain energy.â€

â€œIf you eat too much sugar, your mitochondria will no longer easily produce energy from fatâ€”theyâ€™ll start producing all of your energy from glucose. This means that instead of your brain using fat as its fuel, the fat gets stored in your fat cells and youâ€™ll start to gain weight.â€

â€œPerhaps the most important factor in determining your rate of neurogenesis is your diet. Certain foods decrease your rate of neurogenesis while others enhance it.â€

â€œYour neurons require massive amounts of energy to function and they die when they donâ€™t get it.â€

â€œEat more good fat, particularly healthy saturated fat from grass-fed butter and meat.â€

â€œYour brain is actually the first part of the body to suffer when you are chronically inflamed.â€

â€œWhen you dial down the swelling in your body or in your brain, the fog suddenly clears. You think more clearly, focus when you want to, and remember things with ease.â€

â€œThe same foods that cause your body to become inflamed are also making your brain foggy and inflamed.â€

â€œBy offering exposure to the right kinds of light, feeding the good bacteria in your gut, balancing your hormones, and of course improving your mitochondrial function and efficiency, the Head Strong program will help you dial down the inflammation that is quietly raging throughout your entire bodyâ€”and especially in your brain.â€

Iâ€™m reading this book because I suffer from fatigue, poor sleep quality, and environmental toxins. If you can relate to any of the common issues discussed in these chapters, know that they are not â€œnormalâ€ and you donâ€™t have to live with them forever! Through the Head Strong program, youâ€™ll develop a sharper brain and lead a happier, healthier life. ğŸ™Œ

Ready to dive into part 2 of Head Strong?!

If youâ€™re behind on your reading, itâ€™s not too late to catch up! Our week 2 reading assignment is less than 80 pages and full of pretty riveting information!

Tell us what you thought about these first few chapters in the comment section of this post or in our exclusive Hip2Keto Facebook Group. Let us know your biggest takeaways from each weekâ€™s chapters and chat with other Hip2Keto readers to compare notes.
